snippet: The Mets dropped their spring training opener to the Nationals after the team’s owners were ordered to pay up to $83 million to the trustee representing Bernard L. Madoff’s victims.
abstract: New York Mets drop their spring training opener to the Washington Nationals, 3-1, but Mets players seem oblivious to court battle engulfing the owners.
lead_paragraph: The Mets dropped their spring training opener to the Nationals after the team’s owners were ordered to pay up to $83 million to the trustee representing Bernard L. Madoff’s victims.

headline.seo: Mets Players Unfazed by Legal Case Involving Owners
headline.main: Oblivious to Court Battle, Mets Drop Their Opener
headline.print_headline: Oblivious to Court Battle, Mets Drop Their Opener
